    • properties

      public java.util.Map<NounName,​java.util.List<PropertyName>> properties()
      Return an unmodifiableMap of the map properties (to perform an iteration on the map)
      Returns:
      An unmodifiableList version of properties

    • verticalProperty

      public void verticalProperty​(Operator operator, WordList wordList, NounMap nounMap) throws java.io.IOException
      Perform the appropriate action if operator do form a vertical sentence
      Parameters:
      operator - The operator we are method on
      wordList - List of all the words (noun's name/properties/operators) we check to see if there's a sentence formed
      nounMap - The nounMap, in case there's sentence like "Rock Is Wall". In this case, we need to change all the Rock noun into Wall noun
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • horizontalProperty

      public void horizontalProperty​(Operator operator, WordList wordList, NounMap nounMap) throws java.io.IOException
      Perform the appropriate action if operator does form an horizontal sentence
      Parameters:
      operator - The operator we are method on
      wordList - List of all the words (noun's name/properties/operators) we check to see if there's a sentence formed
      nounMap - The nounMap, in case there's sentence like "Rock Is Wall". In this case, we need to change all the Rock noun into Wall noun
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • checkProperties

      public void checkProperties​(WordList wordList, NounMap nounMap) throws java.io.IOException
      Check all word in the wordList to see if a sentence is formed. Add them to the appropriate map (ex. : Noun Operator Property)
      Parameters:
      wordList - List of all the words (noun's name/properties/operators) we check to see if there's a sentence formed
      nounMap - The nounMap, in case there's sentence like "Rock Is Wall". In this case, we need to change all the Rock noun into Wall noun
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • add

      public void add​(NounName nounName, PropertyName propertyName)
      Add propertyName in propertyMap, with key == nounName
      Parameters:
      nounName - The key which we add the property to
      propertyName - The property we are adding in nounName's values

    • getYouNoun

      public java.util.List<NounName> getYouNoun()
      Return You's nounName. It's a list since there can be several You noun.
      Returns:
      List of all the You's noun
